Add lemmas `tendsto_indicator_thickening_indicator_closure` and `tendsto_indicator_cthickening_indicator_closure`.

Co-authored-by: @sgouezel and @urkud

---

This was PR [mathlib3#17648](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/17648). There were reviews by @sgouezel and @urkud, but I temporarily abandoned the PR during the semester and the ongoing port to Mathlib4. This Mathlib4 PR takes into account the review comments from the mathlib3 PR.

nodes.body: My involvement into the filter cult forces me to mention that the "true" underlying result is that, in a regular space, `Set.indicator` tends to `Set.indicator (closure E)` along the filter `(ùìùÀ¢ E).smallSets ‚äì ùìü (ùí´ E)`, and that you can deduce your result using the fact that `Metric.thickening` tends to this filter along `ùìù 0` :grin: That wouldn't actually require *that much* new API, but of course I don't want to hold this PR for that at all!

> I left one suggestion and two answers to comments by S√©bastien in the Lean3 PR, otherwise this looks good to me.
> 
> Do you want to wait for Yury and/or S√©bastien to comment, or is it fine if I "maintainer merge" this?

First of all, thank you for adding the clear responses to the two comments! I had indeed implemented only those suggested generalizations in the mathlib3 PR which were provable, and left two unprovable ones unproven (and since S√©bastien had also used a very different tone in the unprovable ones, I interpreted them more as rhetorical questions for contrast in the first place). I hope the file also makes it evident that the chosen formulations were deliberate, for example by the different use "as Œ¥ tends to zero" vs "as Œ¥>0 tends to zero" in the docstrings.

I don't have an opinion on whether we should wait for further reviews from S√©bastien and/or Yury. I believe I took into account all of their review comments so far (but I don't know if they would have had further ones). So either way is ok with me.

I left one suggestion and two answers to comments by S√©bastien in the Lean3 PR, otherwise this looks good to me.

Do you want to wait for Yury and/or S√©bastien to comment, or is it fine if I "maintainer merge" this?

```suggestion
/-- Pointwise, the multiplicative indicators of Œ¥-thickenings of a set eventually coincide 
with the multiplicative indicator of the set as Œ¥>0 tends to zero. -/
@[to_additive "Pointwise, the indicators of Œ¥-thickenings of a set eventually coincide 
with the indicator of the set as Œ¥>0 tends to zero."]
```

Same below
Thanks! I will create separate docstrings for the additive versions in the other statements, too.

To answer [this comment](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/17648#discussion_r1050198648), indeed you can't do better than `ùìù[>] (0 : ‚Ñù)` here since it doesn't work for `Œ¥ = 0`.

To answer [this comment](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/17648#discussion_r1050198980), you also can't put `ùìù (0 : ‚Ñù)` here, because (at least when `Œ≤` is T1) this would imply that `closure E` is empty (thanks to [eq_of_tendsto_nhds](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Separation.html#eq_of_tendsto_nhds))

```suggestion
    filter_upwards [mem_nhdsWithin_of_mem_nhds obs, self_mem_nhdsWithin]
      with Œ¥ x_notin_thE Œ¥_pos
```
Sorry, I missed that on first read. The whole point of `filter_upwards` is that you don't have to use `Eventually.and` or `inter_mem`!

```
  exact (((ENNReal.ofReal_lt_ofReal_iff Œµ_pos).mpr hŒ¥).trans Œµ_lt).le
```

Btw, these kinds of terms are a mouthful, and I still often end up writing them. Clearly this is bad for readability --- is there a more stylish way?

(Although, for mathematically obvious lemmas like this and the next, I'm of the opinion that only the readability of the statement is important, while their trivial proofs can be obfuscated/golfed. But I would understand also the desire to write readable terms in the proof... So if there is an easy style improvement, I'd be happy to learn it!)

There isn't really any universal trick. I guess this is slightly better:
```lean
  obtain ‚ü®Œµ, ‚ü®Œµ_pos, Œµ_lt‚ü©‚ü© := exists_real_pos_lt_infEdist_of_not_mem_closure h
  filter_upwards [eventually_lt_nhds Œµ_pos] with Œ¥ hŒ¥
  simp only [thickening, mem_setOf_eq, not_lt]
  exact le_trans (ENNReal.ofReal_le_ofReal hŒ¥.le) Œµ_lt.le
```
Note that the reason the term looks better is that the mathematical proof is very slightly simpler (we're just using that `ofReal` is monotone, so no need for `Œµ_pos` to appear).

About the `filter_upwards` line: technically this does exactly the same as the current code, except that you end up with `hŒ¥ : Œ¥ < Œµ` instead of `hŒ¥ : Œ¥ ‚àà Iio Œµ`, allowing dot notation. In general I would suggest using the `Eventually` version over the `_ ‚àà ‚Ñ±` version in `filter_upwards` when both exist, but it's not really important.
Oh and of course you can also modify the `cthickening` version in a similar way.

```suggestion
      with Œ¥ x_notin_thE _
    simp only [x_notin_thE, not_false_eq_true, mulIndicator_of_not_mem, x_mem_closure]
```

```suggestion
    simp only [hŒ¥, not_false_eq_true, mulIndicator_of_not_mem, x_mem_closure]
```
